Once in a vibrant town, there lived a boy named Leo, known for his peculiar balloon hands. Instead of fingers, colorful balloons floated where his hands should be, bobbing gently in the breeze. Leo discovered that he could inflate or deflate them at will, allowing him to create whimsical shapes and entertain children. One day, during a festival, he used his hands to craft a magnificent balloon dragon that soared above the crowd. Everyone gasped in awe, and Leo realized his unique gift could bring joy. From that day on, he embraced his balloon hands, spreading happiness wherever he went.
